text: all right you guys I thought today was an off day but GameStop is wellbe in GameStop today I was looking at the options chain kind of going through markets doing my standard scan quiet Wednesday afternoon I thought we were just going to be managing existing positions maybe see if anything weird is going on and then game stopped as this something super weird and I'm curious if you could tell what it is right from what you're seeing here it might be a little difficult to see this one but this is the options chain from today the 19th of June and it's in the evening it's like 700 Pacific time and this is what I see that's really super surprising to me at this point there is a 47 Point increase in the volatility in the front expiration cycle that is due to expire in 2 days the market was closed today yet this is up massively from where the market closed yesterday now if you recall from the conversation yesterday the move down here didn't surprise me after the shareholders meeting came through made sense I actually thought after the shares shareholders meeting we would have gone closer to this rate from the jump took an extra day sometimes V bleeds out a little more slowly but then I did not expect at all to see a near 50 point increase in volatility faity with 2 days left to go the other thing is right now

gone closer to this rate from the jump took an extra day sometimes V bleeds out a little more slowly but then I did not expect at all to see a near 50 point increase in volatility faity with 2 days left to go the other thing is right now I cannot see a clear Catalyst of sorts I genuinely do not know why this would be up 47 points in addition that I also find really interesting is the next expiration cycle also went up 10 points it went from 15124 up to 16117 that is also not an in significant move for something like this it's almost a 10 increase so something again is going on and as I was looking through trying to figure out what this is why this might be happening what this what's driving it I cannot find a clear answer here I don't see anything in the options chain that's absolutely out of place to me we did talk about the series of really large orders at the 30s which is still massive and then the 35s but the problem that these orders are going to face is the insane Theta Decay that they're going to experience over the next couple days so for example the 35s they have 18 19 cents left of total value but the Theta Decay is 17 cents on the day so it means after a day passes essentially these become worthless even the 30s they're going to

they're going to experience over the next couple days so for example the 35s they have 18 19 cents left of total value but the Theta Decay is 17 cents on the day so it means after a day passes essentially these become worthless even the 30s they're going to lose essentially their entire value after the pass of a single day right now they're worth 33 cents they data Decay on them is 27 so unless there's this some sort of massive accommodating move that I still genuinely don't see and as I continue to remind people I am not here to spread hype or fud I'm doing my best just to look at the data and share what I'm seeing and right now I'm confused I don't see what's driving this as a right now so part of the reason for this video is to ask you guys if you're seeing anything that can explain what's happening right now cuz I don't see it now a couple other things that I wanted to take a look at was the volatility smile we've been looking at this pretty regularly together now and one of the things I did notice compared to what I was looking at yesterday was kind of twofold the first thing was this kind of smile on the next week expiration is about the same it flattened out a little bit in the tail but the smile for this expiration did actually see an uptick in

compared to what I was looking at yesterday was kind of twofold the first thing was this kind of smile on the next week expiration is about the same it flattened out a little bit in the tail but the smile for this expiration did actually see an uptick in the implied volatility being applied to the out-of-the money calls so I can't fully tell if that's just the market kind of dealing with this excessively High open interest with a really short duration left and we need to see what happens to these 70,000 open interest at the 30s because there was 42,000 volume yesterday and these obviously didn't update yet cuz today's not a trading day they'll update tomorrow so I'm really interested to see what this 70,000 turns into and if there's significant buying going on here that does start to get a little interesting we can see that there's a lot of volatility wrapped around this specific strike 28 but again I don't I don't see what's driving us here so interesting find this has even gone up since we were talking literally already it was 20785 when we were looking at it last and it's already up to 20860 so this is not moving an insignificant amount wanted to share it with you guys I don't know exactly what's going on yet but this looks interesting to me so we will see what happens tomorrow catch you guys later
